topic: AI regulation and governance in the UK
summary: The UK government is actively engaging with stakeholders following the closure of a formal consultation on AI regulation on June 21, 2023. The National AI Strategy emphasizes a pro-innovation approach to governing AI, with a white paper outlining proposals for a future-proof regulatory framework. This framework aims to foster an environment conducive to AI development, driving growth and public trust while positioning the UK as a global leader in AI technologies. The government recognizes AI as a critical technology and is committed to harnessing its benefits for economic prosperity.
takeaways: The formal consultation on AI regulation closed on June 21, 2023, but stakeholder engagement continues.
The UK government aims to develop a pro-innovation framework for regulating AI as part of its National AI Strategy.
AI is identified as one of five critical technologies in the UK Science and Technology Framework.
The new regulatory approach is intended to boost innovation, investment, and public trust in AI.
The UK government seeks to strengthen the country's position as a global leader in AI development.
